definition.name: NXcs_prng

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

definition.doc:
Computer science description of pseudo-random number generator.
The purpose of such metadata is to identify if exactly the same sequence can be reproduced, like for a PRNG or not (for a true physically random source).

field.name: type
field.doc: Physical approach or algorithm whereby random numbers are generated.

group.doc: Name of the PRNG implementation and version. If such information is not available or if the PRNG type was set to other the DOI to the publication or the source code should be given.

field.name: seed
field.doc: Parameter of the PRNG controlling its initialization and thus controlling the specific sequence generated.

field.name: warmup
field.doc: Number of initial draws from the PRNG after its initialized with the seed. These initial draws are discarded in an effort to equilibrate the sequence. If no warmup was performed or if warmup procedures are unclear, users should set the value to zero.
